result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julian Alatorre Magana

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Adjustment Number: 22A 101425,
Payable Number: 1040649,
Receipt Number: 22RP042603,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Julian Alatorre Magana in court.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court for Julian Alatorre Magana.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Court set a sentencing date before Judge John Franke in Room 310 of the Safety Building.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-26-2022

Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Julian Alatorre Magana in court, appear by video with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt, appear by video.  Defendant Julian Alatorre Magana in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J.Ayala.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Date provided by Branch 40 clerk.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Julian Alatorre Magana in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant Julian Alatorre Magana in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Julian Alatorre Magana appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Julian Alatorre Magana in court with attorney Helmi Hamad, as friend of the court.  Defendant Julian Alatorre Magana in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Julian Alatorre Magana appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant stated he's retained private counsel.  Case passed to allow Defendant to contact his attorney.
